match (u) where u.name = #{name} return u.name as name, u.type as type
MATCH (m{ name:#{relation.nameA}}) MATCH (n{ name:#{relation.nameB}}) MATCH (m)-[:${relation.relation}]->(n) return n,m
mapper.delete: match p=(x)-[r]->(y) where x.name=#{relation.nameA} and y.name=#{relation.nameB} and r.name="${relation.relation}" delete r
match p=(x)-[r]->(y) where x.name=#{relation.nameA_old} and y.name=#{relation.nameB_old} and r.name="${relation.relation}" delete r

match p=(x)-[r]->(y) where r.name=#{relation.relation} return x.name as nameA, r.name as relation, y.name as nameB
match p=(x)-[r]->(y) where x.name="${relation.nameA}" and y.name="${relation.nameB}" and r.name="ties" return x.name as nameA, r.name as relation, y.name as nameB, r.ties as ties

match p=(x)-[r]->(y) where x.name="${relation.nameA}" and y.name="${relation.nameB}" and r.name = "ties" set r.ties = ${relation.ties}
